unit.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a group of people working together as part of a larger group
unit.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The man is in the hospital’s intensive care unit.
unit.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: an amount of something used as a standard of measurement
unit.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The watt is a unit of electrical power.
unit.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a thing, person, or group that is regarded as one single whole part of something larger
unit.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The family is the basic social unit of modern society.
unit.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: one of the numbered parts into which a textbook (=a book used in schools) is divided
unit.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a single complete product made by a company
unit.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The factory’s output is now up to 150,000 units each month.
unit.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a piece of equipment which is part of a larger machine
unit.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a piece of furniture, especially one that can be attached to others of the same type
unit.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a single apartment in a larger building
unit.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: an amount of work that a student needs to do in order to complete a particular course
unit.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: any whole number less than ten
unit.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a single complete product made by a company
unit.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Output is now up to 150,000 units each month.
The unit cost (=cost to make one unit) of the computer system comprised about 80% materials, 15% overheads and 5% labour.
Unit sales (=number of units sold) of watches climbed about 35% last year.
unit.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a company, organization, or group that is part of a larger company, organization, or group
unit.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The computer maker agreed to sell its Network Services unit.
the fiber optics business unit of Tyco Electronics
She works in the production unit.
unit.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: an amount or quantity of something used as a standard of measurement
unit.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The dollar is the basic unit of currency in the US.
unit.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a single share in a UNIT TRUST
unit.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: The company is splitting its 5p nominal shares into units of 2.5p to increase their marketability
unit.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: a single building on an INDUSTRIAL ESTATE
unit.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: He is renting a factory unit as a workshop.
unit.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: a piece of machinery which is part of a larger machine
unit.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: This is the control unit for the central heating.
